Description: Pottery coarseware cooking pot; depressed biconical body on a rounded base; short conical neck (prominent ridge at the junction with the shoulder inside the vessel); single strap handle from shoulder to rim; red clay with numerous small inclusions; surface encrusted.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: See D. Bailey, Op. Ath VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations at Kourion. The basic shape is found on Cyprus from late Cypro-Archaic down to Hellenistic times, though the better quality of manufacture and angular features of the present item might suggest a later date: J. Webb 2001, Cypriot antiquities in the Nicolson Museum at the University of Sydney. CCA 20. SIMA XX:20, Jonsered, no. 284 (with refs).
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
